title: Basking in the here and now with my kids
content: Recently, my elder daughter F and I encouraged each other to read Agatha Christie's And Then There Were None and Suzanne Collins' The Hunger Games.    Fascinated by the breathlessly thrilling murder-mystery about 10 people who are killed on a remote island, F, who is 11, recommended the former to me. And I, still in love with rebel fighter Katniss Everdeen's sass in the dystopian world of Panem, urged her to dive into the young adult title.
